column3: News;Phnom Penh: Director General of Cambodia’s Civil Aviation Authority
column5: has denied that missing aircraft MH370  has been spotted in the Cambodian jungle on Google Maps. ------Keo Sivorn confirmed to Rasmei Kampuchea on the morning of September 4 that the claims were just fictional.------The refusal from  Cambodia’s civil aviation director took place after the British newspaper
column7: posted on September 3 that MH370 had crashed in Cambodia.------The Daily Star quoted Ian Wilson
column9: who confirmed the detection of the MH370 through Google Maps and Google Earth.------MH370 went missing on March 8
column10: with 239 people aboard.  The disappearance of MH370 is considered one of the greatest mysteries in history.------http://www.rasmeinews.com/%E1%9E%A2%E1%9E%82%E1%9F%92%E1%9E%82%E1%9E%93%E1%9E%B6%E1%9E%99%E1%9E%80%E2%80%8B%E1%9E%A2%E1%9E%B6%E1%9E%80%E1%9E%B6%E1%9E%9F%E1%9E%85%E1%9E%9A%E1%9E%8E%E1%9F%8D%E2%80%8B%E1%9E%9F%E1%9F%8A%E1%9E%B8/------
